summary: This document is an email chain from November 2021 regarding travel and hotel arrangements for a witness and her family to attend the Ghislaine Maxwell trial in New York. It includes a forwarded hotel confirmation for a stay at Hotel 50 Bowery from September 2021.

persons.name: Sandra Ramos
persons.context: Executive Assistant at Freedom Hospitality who sent the hotel confirmation email for Hotel 50 Bowery.

persons.name: Anthony Toliver
persons.context: Was copied on the initial hotel confirmation email from Sandra Ramos.

events.title: Planned Travel for Maxwell Trial
events.description: A witness and her family plan to travel to New York to attend the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, intending to fly in on December 1st and stay until December 7th.

events.title: Hotel Stay at Hotel 50 Bowery
events.description: A reservation was confirmed for a stay at Hotel 50 Bowery in New York City.

locations: Hotel 50 Bowery, 50 Bowery, New York, NY 10013-4801, US
United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Freedom Hospitality, 100 Park Avenue, 16th Floor, New York, NY 10017
keyFacts: The email discusses travel coordination for a witness and her family (including her husband and mother) to attend the Ghislaine Maxwell trial in December 2021.
The correspondence is between a witness/victim's family and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), indicating official coordination for trial attendance.
A hotel confirmation for Hotel 50 Bowery from September 2021 is attached, showing prior travel arrangements possibly related to the case.
The email chain shows the U.S. Attorney's Office arranging and paying for travel and accommodations for trial witnesses.
Multiple names and email addresses are redacted, protecting the identities of the witness and her family members.
